title: Peter Lynch Playbook: How to Spot a Ten-Bagger

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Invest in what you know — Lynch’s signature rule. Your shopping cart can be your stock screener.
beats.imagePrompt: A casual investor in a grocery aisle, lightbulb over their head, noticing a crowded shelf with a hot-selling product; soft warm lighting, realistic style.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Start with everyday insights, then dig into the company’s filings. (See *One Up on Wall Street* for Lynch’s own mall-walking anecdotes.)

htmlPrompt.prompt: Slide titled 'Step 1: Invest in What You Know'. Flowchart: Everyday Observation → Stock Idea → Read 10-K → Decision.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Do your homework. A great product isn’t enough if the balance sheet is a mess.
beats.imagePrompt: Open notebook, magnifying glass over financial statements, background of ticker tape; realistic photo-illustration.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Check earnings growth, debt levels, and the PEG ratio ≈ 1. If the numbers don’t sing, pass.

htmlPrompt.prompt: Clean table comparing two hypothetical companies: Revenue Growth, Debt/Equity, PEG; highlight the stronger candidate in green.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Classify your stocks — Lynch used six buckets to set expectations.
beats.imagePrompt: Six colored boxes orbiting a central stock certificate, each labeled: Slow Grower, Stalwart, Fast Grower, Cyclical, Turnaround, Asset Play.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Knowing the category tells you what good performance looks like — a Stalwart doubling is a win, a Fast Grower only doubling may disappoint.

htmlPrompt.prompt: Radial diagram titled 'Lynch’s Six Stock Types' with brief one-line descriptions under each segment.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Hold for the long haul. Compounding works if you stay on the ride.
beats.imagePrompt: Roller-coaster graphic labeled 'Market', investor calmly seated with seatbelt, coaster ascends over years.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Lynch’s Magellan Fund averaged 29% annually by letting winners run instead of selling at the first dip.

htmlPrompt.prompt: Line chart: Value of $10 000 invested in Magellan (1977-1990) versus S&P 500; Magellan curve highlighted.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Ignore the noise. Headlines change daily; company fundamentals move slowly.
beats.imagePrompt: Newspaper storm swirling around a calm investor wearing headphones, serene blue background.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Tune out pundits and focus on quarterly reports — not Fed gossip.

htmlPrompt.prompt: Minimalist slide: left column 'Market Noise' (blurry headlines); right column 'Company Signals' (EPS, revenue, backlog) with checkmarks.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Hunt for ten-baggers — the stocks that can grow 10×.
beats.imagePrompt: Rocket-ship shaped like a dollar sign blasting off from a small cap launchpad toward a ten-bag banner.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Ten-baggers often start as overlooked small companies with accelerating sales and a huge runway.

htmlPrompt.prompt: Bullet list titled 'Early Ten-Bagger Clues': TAM → accelerating EPS → low institutional ownership → insider buying.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Be ready to revise. Even great theses age; revisit them with new data.
beats.imagePrompt: Investor erasing part of a whiteboard thesis and rewriting updated numbers; dynamic hand-drawn style.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Sell when facts change — not when the price wiggles.

htmlPrompt.prompt: Decision tree: 'Is the original reason still true?' → Yes (Hold) / No (Re-evaluate or Sell).

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Key metrics Lynch loved: PEG≈1, low debt, insider ownership.
beats.imagePrompt: Close-up of a dashboard gauge cluster: PEG meter, Debt meter, Insider stake meter all in green zone.

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Mix these metrics with the earlier steps and you’ve got a Lynch-approved shortlist.

htmlPrompt.prompt: Checklist slide with tick boxes: PEG~1 ✔️, Debt/Equity < 0.5 ✔️, Insider stake > 5% ✔️, Steady EPS growth ✔️.
